page.title: 02Place names of the area
page.content: Earlsfield means"land held by an earl". The land in this area was owned by Earl Spencer,an ancestor of the Princess of Wales.Garratt means "place with or near a watch tower" and is the origin of Garratt Lane,a long road in Tooting. Southfields means"southern arable lands"of Wandsworth.Summerstown means "development on land owned by Summers", a family mentioned in documents of the seventeenth and eighteenth centuries. Tooting means "people of Tota".In the Middle Ages there were two manors here, Tooting Bec and Tooting Graveney.The former was held by the Abbey of St.Mary of Bec-Hellouin in Normandy and the latter by Richard de Gravenel. Wimbledon means "wynnman's hill".On the top of the hill is the village, on the site of the original settlement.
